snippet: Lawmakers sidestepped the debate over the extent of American military action until the lame-duck session of Congress later this year.
abstract: Senate gives overwhelming approval to the training and arming of Syrian rebels, then flees the Capitol with the House for the fall campaign, avoiding the debate over the extent of American military action until the lame-duck session of Congress later this year.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: Lawmakers sidestepped the debate over the extent of American military action until the lame-duck session of Congress later this year.

headline.main: Congress Gives Final Approval to Aid Rebels in Fight With ISIS
headline.print_headline: Senate Approves Training and Arming Syrian Rebels

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
